data.title: If you don't like spicy food, stay away. Otherwise, it's awesome!
data.text:
My husband and I went there for the first time for dinner on a Friday evening. People waited to get a seat, but all said "it's totally worth it."

My husband loved this place! I, on the other hand, cannot handle spicy food so my experience was more frustrating (since there were not many options). He'll definitely be back.

Our server, and service overall, was great. This is also BYOB ;)

data.title: Best Tex Mex in Allen
data.text: Food is always good, service is generally good too, prices are decent, arguably the best Tex Mex restaurant in Allen, TX

data.title: Good experience
data.text: We visited this place for the first time last night! The chips and the dips were really good! Fresh and warm chips is always a plus! Service was good! The food was also really good! I think if we eat here again, we will try take out! The problem is the restaurant is very small and not much room to sit down, and they are so good that they are super busy! So you get rushed to eat your food and get out! And since it's a small area, it get very loud very fast! So not type of place to sit down and enjoy!( again this was our first time, maybe they were just busy last night and it's not always like this?!) anyways, overall, great experience with the food and the service!

data.title: Great!
data.text: Not just the best molé in Allen...it's the best molé in the entire Dallas area!  Chips are fresh and crispy thin.  All three salsas are delicious and you basically can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

data.title: Outstanding TexMex!
data.text:
My wife and I were looking for a good place to eat after shopping at the outlet mall and found this hole-in-the-wall Mexican restaurant in trip advisor. Oscar and Ashley's place is not far from the mall but a little difficult to find, but google maps took us right to the place. 

They have three sauces with corn chips to start. A tomatillo sauce, a tomato salsa, and a spicy salsa. All are fresh made and outstanding. 

I had a chicken enchilada with sour cream sauce and a tamale with chili con carne, rice, and charo beans. Misty also had the chicken enchilada, but also a cheese enchilada with chili con queso, rice and refried beans. Everything was very good, but both enchiladas were the best. 

Oscar personally came out to ask us about our meal. He told us the small building was once the old post office. He found the building and went into business about 6 years ago. The place seems to be a locals favorite. 

If you are ever in Allen TX you must try this place!

data.title: Personalized Dining at its Best
data.text:
As a retired couple living in McKinney, we eat out most meals.  We really enjoyed the La Finca-Allen restaurant both for the food and for the personal service.  The owner and his wife are present and very hands-on with their business.  Super nice people.

If you like sautéed spinach, be sure and try the delicious Spinach Quesadilla with fajita chicken.

data.title: Wonderful, as always!
data.text: My husband and I just love going to this quaint restaurant...(it's the old Allen post office). Ashley and her husband, Oscar, own the place and one of them is always there making sure everything is running smoothly.  We're what ya call "regulars".  😃

data.title: Dinner with My Brother and Sister in Law
data.text:
My Brother-in-law is recovering from open heart surgery and we were visiting him in Allen. Everybody was hungry so he suggested that we try La Finca Chiquita in downtown Allen. The place is small and quaint Tex Mex restaurant. The place was fairly crowded and appears to be doing real well which is good.  The food was excellent and the service was very good. They offer three types of hot sauce and offer you choices like ordering a taco and and enchilada.  You have a choice of toppings like cheese or chile con carne. We all ordered different things and also had the charro bean soup. I can say it was some of the best charro bean soup that I have had.

I say try it. I think you will like it.

This business deserves the support of Allen.

data.title: Ok
data.text:
My last two visits have been disappointing.  The tortilla soup is not much more than broth, chicken meat, chips, avocado and cheese in a tiny cup.  It also was very expensive.  It did taste good.

The salsa cups barely had any sauce for a table of 4.  

Some of the others in my group had the small nachos and it was a generous size.

Service is ok but not friendly the past two visits.

owner_response.author: Oscar_Ashley_Cavazos, Owner at La Finca Chiquita, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you TexasFamily1 so much for bringing this to my attention. I would really like to address the service issues as soon as possible. 
Could you please email me at oscar@mychiquita.com with more information (server's name or description, date of experiences, etc...). This will be addressed immediately. 
Thank you again so much for the feedback. We want to do better. Our guests deserve great experiences, and my wife and I are completely committed to hitting that mark. 

Sincerely, 
Oscar Cavazos
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best Tex Mex I have had. Small family owned business.
data.text:
The best Tex Mex I have ever had. Small family owned business. Food is prepared when you order. Excellent quality. 

Kind of a small "hole in the wall" place. Not very big inside. Has takeout. Give it a try. You will not be sorry.

data.title: Friendly staff and delicious food!
data.text: This small, out of the way little restaurant really makes up in service and food what the building lacks in size. I have lived in the Allen area for quite a few years now, and this is one of my favorite places to eat in the area. The food is always great, choices are plentiful, and the staff is ALWAYS friendly and attentive. I highly suggest visiting here whenever you are in the area. Or, if you're not in the area, it's definitely worth a trip!

data.title: Our fav
data.text: Our standby, and judging by the wait on Fridays and Saturdays,  everybody else's too. No matter, worth the wait.  Note it's  BYOB.

data.title: Tex Mex Done Right
data.text: I placed an order to go based on reviews stating small and big crowds. My grandkids are not very patient. We ordered a dozen tamales, beef and chicken quesadillas, rice, beans, chile con carne, guacamole, chips and salsa. Everything we ordered was delicious and well prepared. Tamales were moist and tender, some of the best I ever had eaten. A new go to place. As a side note Wednesday they have an enchilada special so there is a large crowd and the wait was 20 min.

data.title: Good food
data.text: Great food but the waitress stumbles all over herself trying to anticipate your needs without ever actually stopping to listen.

owner_response.author: Oscar_Ashley_Cavazos, Owner at La Finca Chiquita, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Gabrielle!
Thank you for your reviews.
I noticed your review from 2 years ago also mentioned a less than stellar service experience. This is something I really want to get a handle on. :-)
Your kids have my cell phone number from when they were on our team a few years ago. Please give me a call or text anytime you feel that we miss our mark on service so that I can address any issues right away.
We're so grateful for your family's longtime support! We were excited to cater your church event as well! Thank you so much.
See you soon!
Oscar Cavazos
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great local Mexican food
data.text: Always great food at this quaint family-feel restaurant.  Be sure to try the ribs!     Excellent always!   We are there at least once a week.

data.title: SMALL place but GREAT TEX MEX!
data.text: I want a family of been going to Lafinca for years now. They had a larger location but it closedown for five years ago. I believe it's the daughter or son that opened this location and the food is excellent!don't expect anything from the restaurant itself and you'll do great! It's clean. It's small. But again the food is excellent! Five stars! Reminds me of San Antonio!

data.title: Good Tex-Mex
data.text:
Small (very) local restaurant with a lot of "regulars". Good food, good prices, good service. All together these three equal a good value.
Chicken tortilla soup is famous. Very good.

data.title: Off the beaten path
data.text:
Tex mex at its best!
Rice , beans, tortilla soup are SO GOOD!!
Have great lunch specials!
Can be a wait from noon to 1245!
Tiny place, qualifies as a (clean not scary) hole in the wall stop!! A must eat at location .

data.title: Feels like home!
data.text:
Outstanding service and personal attendance! 
Food is extremely fresh!  
Busy place, so go early or after busy dinner hour!

data.title: Best Tex MEx in Allen
data.text: Forget all the rest, hands down the best Tex Mex in Allen. Located in Downtown Allen in the old post office building, it looks like a dump, but the food is great.
